intro: Pterocarpus micropterus, commonly known as the Malabar kino tree, is a tropical tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The tree produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by elongated, woody pods containing flat, dark seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in dense forests. The plant is valued for its timber and has traditional uses in medicine and dye production.
